qas.question: How did von Neumann raise the level of economics?
What did von Neumann prove with his model of expanding economy?

answers.text: uniqueness of an equilibrium using his generalization of the Brouwer fixed-point theorem

qas.question: What did von Neumann consider for his model of expanding economy?

answers.text: matrix pencil  A − λB with nonnegative matrices A and B

context: Von Neumann raised the intellectual and mathematical level of economics in <a0_0>several stunning publications<a0_0/>. For his model of an expanding economy, von Neumann proved the existence and <a1_0>uniqueness of an equilibrium using his generalization of the Brouwer fixed-point theorem<a1_0/>. Von Neumann's model of an expanding economy considered the <a2_0>matrix pencil  A − λB with nonnegative matrices A and B<a2_0/>; von Neumann sought probability vectors p and q and a positive number λ that would solve the complementarity equation
